Package net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class AbstractProcessExecutor

  • Object
    • AbstractProcessExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, ProcessExecutor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleProcessExecutor
    public abstract class AbstractProcessExecutor
extends Object
implements ProcessExecutor, Runnable
    An abstract implementation of the ProcessExecutor interface for starting, managing, and interacting with a process. The life cycle of the associated process is encapsulated within that of the run() method.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  AbstractProcessExecutor.ProcessException
      An exception thrown if an unexpected error occurs while running or interacting with a process.
      protected static interface  AbstractProcessExecutor.ThrowingRunnable
      A functional interface for a runnable that may throw checked exceptions and errors.

      protected ExecutorService threadPool  
      static int UNEXPECTED_TERMINATION_RETURN_CODE
      If a process cannot be started or an exception occurs which would make it impossible to retrieve the actual return code of the process.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected AbstractProcessExecutor​(ProcessManager manager, ExecutorService threadPool)
      Constructs an executor for the specified process using threadPool to provide the threads required for listening to the standard streams of the process and ensuring that the process is terminated once it times out if the ProcessManager.getKeepAliveTime() method of manager returns a non-empty optional.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      void execute​(Submission<?> submission)
      It has the process sequentially execute the commands contained in the submission and blocks until the execution of every command is complete.

      Returns a map of additional child threads to run where the keys are the names of the child threads and the values are the runnable tasks.

      Returns whether the process executor is alive.

      A method called after the startup of the process and the set up of the executor.
      protected abstract void onExecutorTermination()
      A call-back method invoked after the termination of the underlying process and the stopping of the executor's helper threads.
      void run()  
      void terminate()
      It attempts to terminate the process using the termination submission defined by the process manger, if there is one, then proceeds to forcibly shut down the process if it is still alive.
      protected void terminateForcibly()
      It sends a kill signal to the currently running process, if there is one.
      protected boolean tryExecute​(Submission<?> submission, boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
      Attempts to execute the specified submission synchronously by delegating its commands to the underlying process serially and processing the responses of the process.
      protected boolean tryTerminate()
      It attempts to terminate the currently running process, if there is one, using the ProcessManager.getTerminationSubmission() method of the process manager assigned to the executor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProcessExecutor

        protected AbstractProcessExecutor​(ProcessManager manager,
                                  ExecutorService threadPool)
        Constructs an executor for the specified process using threadPool to provide the threads required for listening to the standard streams of the process and ensuring that the process is terminated once it times out if the ProcessManager.getKeepAliveTime() method of manager returns a non-empty optional.
        Parameters:
        manager - The ProcessManager instance to manage the life-cycle of the underlying process.
        threadPool - The thread pool to use for running the helper threads required for the running of the process and the execution of submissions.

    • Method Detail

      • getAdditionalChildThreads

        protected abstract Map<String,​AbstractProcessExecutor.ThrowingRunnable> getAdditionalChildThreads()
        Returns a map of additional child threads to run where the keys are the names of the child threads and the values are the runnable tasks. If no tasks are to be executed as child threads, it should return an empty map.
        Returns:
        A map of child thread tasks.

      • onExecutorStartup

        protected abstract void onExecutorStartup()
        A method called after the startup of the process and the set up of the executor.

      • onExecutorTermination

        protected abstract void onExecutorTermination()
        A call-back method invoked after the termination of the underlying process and the stopping of the executor's helper threads.

      • isAlive

        protected boolean isAlive()
        Returns whether the process executor is alive. The process executor is considered alive if its underlying process is alive and has not not received a kill signal.
        Returns:
        Whether the process executor is alive.

      • tryExecute

        protected boolean tryExecute​(Submission<?> submission,
                             boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
                      throws FailedCommandException,
                             DisruptedExecutionException
        Attempts to execute the specified submission synchronously by delegating its commands to the underlying process serially and processing the responses of the process. If the process is already busy executing, it returns false, otherwise it proceeds to execute the command and returns true.
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to process and execute.
        terminateProcessAfterwards - Whether the process should be terminated after the execution of the submission.
        Returns:
        Whether the execution of the submission was completed.
        Throws:
        FailedCommandException - If a command of the submission fails.
        DisruptedExecutionException - If the process terminates during execution or there is any other error that would disrupt the execution of the submission.

      • tryTerminate

        protected boolean tryTerminate()
        It attempts to terminate the currently running process, if there is one, using the ProcessManager.getTerminationSubmission() method of the process manager assigned to the executor. This might be ineffective if the process is currently executing a command, is not currently running, the optional termination submission is not defined by the process manager, or the termination submission is unsuccessful.
        Returns:
        Whether the termination submission has been successfully executed.

      • terminateForcibly

        protected void terminateForcibly()
        It sends a kill signal to the currently running process, if there is one.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        It attempts to terminate the process using the termination submission defined by the process manger, if there is one, then proceeds to forcibly shut down the process if it is still alive.

      • execute

        public void execute​(Submission<?> submission)
             throws FailedCommandException,
                    DisruptedExecutionException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutor
        It has the process sequentially execute the commands contained in the submission and blocks until the execution of every command is complete. The result of the submission, if there is one, can be subsequently accessed by calling the Submission.getResult() method.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ProcessExecutor
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to execute.
        Throws:
        FailedCommandException - If one of the submission's commands fails.
        DisruptedExecutionException - If the executor is stopped before it could complete the execution of the submission, or if there is any other error unrelated to the submission that leaves the execution of the submission incomplete. Implementations of ProcessExecutor are encouraged to terminate the executor when throwing this exception.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
